flow.descriptionCdata:
4eee6af5-1081-4260-863e-f5f934a93a0f.1f40ad64-4346-4937-a821-7e16f6bc59ee.description=
Returns the length of the list.

Inputs\:
delimiter - The list delimiter.
list - The list to be processed

Responses\:
success - The operation completed Successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
The length of the list.
4eee6af5-1081-4260-863e-f5f934a93a0f.2f0e2fd7-d4b9-4219-9d71-34e55a0c429d.description=
Adds flow variables into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyNames - the names of the flow variables to use
myValues - the values to assign the flow variables
delimiter - a delimiter separating values and keys.

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
4eee6af5-1081-4260-863e-f5f934a93a0f.34fde114-e14f-498f-8c5c-3d362ed71d32.prompt=User Identifier 4eee6af5-1081-4260-863e-f5f934a93a0f.3727c05c-cd46-42d4-b87a-2a6acffbd663.prompt=Component ID 4eee6af5-1081-4260-863e-f5f934a93a0f.5cb1bdb1-4805-492e-b2bc-667ee27a1043.prompt=Property Values 4eee6af5-1081-4260-863e-f5f934a93a0f.5ffa0373-f44b-4f40-aebe-d3982567b0b4.prompt=Enter a value for timeout 4eee6af5-1081-4260-863e-f5f934a93a0f.a685ea99-d0a2-4429-9f9a-95588a8e7b42.description=This workflow adds/updates the component property using Artifact APIs. onlyUpdate\: yes/no yes - To update values of existing property (In this case input "valueType" is not required , This input will not be considered even if provided) no - To add/update property valueType - Value type of the property. It can have value from selection list "CSA-Property-ValueType". This Input is required only when Input "onlyUpdate" is selected as "no". values - One or more values dilimited by comma , (If user want to use some other separator for multiple values then needs to be pass as next input "separator") separator - A delimiter that separates elements in the values ( default dilimiter used is comma ,) 4eee6af5-1081-4260-863e-f5f934a93a0f.aa256c8c-e75f-4277-b2aa-e31ae64b0009.description=This workflow adds/updates the resource binding to the component using Artifact APIs. Inputs\: _COMPONENT_ID - Parent Component Id _RESOURCE_BINDING_XML - XML document to add/update resource binding example\: <\!-- id is not required if creating a new Resource Binding id is required for update --> false ACTIVE RESOURCE_BINDING false BOUND bound This is the Resource Filter <\!-- Provide either id or name, both are not required --> Test_SA_April 19, 2012 5\:08\:43 AM UTC 8ab289a336cdcaf40136e35f1a2e21e8 <\!-- id is not required if creating a new Resource Binding id is required for update --> 0 INITIALIZING PRE_TRANSITION Result\: _RESOURCE_BINDING_ID - Added resource binding Id 4eee6af5-1081-4260-863e-f5f934a93a0f.description=
This workflow adds the SiteScope based resource offering attached to the infrastructure component to its child server components

Inputs\:

srvList		- CSA Component Id of one or more server (delimited by pipe | operator) on which the SiteScope resource binding is to be created
		  Eg \: ||....
userIdentifier	- CSA User Identifier 
sisOffrName		- Name of the HP SiteScope offering to be attached to the sever components.
sisResProviderId	- CSA Resource Provider Id of the HP SiteScope provider to be used by the SiteScope resource binding on the server components
sisTemplatePath	- The path to the CSA templates on the sitescope host (e.g \: CSA templates)

Responses\:
success - Workflow completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.
4eee6af5-1081-4260-863e-f5f934a93a0f.e6063bea-703c-491a-8a91-732de204a9f2.description=
Retrieves a column from a table.

Inputs\:
table - A table to get the column from.
rowDelimiter - the delimiter that separates rows in the table.
columnDelimiter - The delimiter that separates columns in the table.
column - the index of the column (Starting at 0) to retrieve from the table.

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
A rowDelimiter delimited list containing the elements that were in the specified column.
4eee6af5-1081-4260-863e-f5f934a93a0f.e880cace-a3f4-4c51-a388-af419399ffa4.description=
Iterates through a list of values. Modifying the value of the list and delimiter inputs during iteration is not generally supported.

Inputs\:
list - The list to iterate through.
separator - A delimiter that separates elements in the list.

Returns\:
The current element of the list, if the response is has more

Responses\:
has more - Another value was in the list, and has been returned.
has no more - The iterator has gone fully through the list. This response will only be returned once per iteration through the list, a subsequent call to the Iterator will restart the Iteration through the list.
failure - failed to process the list.

Note\: Where the iterator is in the list is tracked by each step's unique id. Therefore you can iterate on the same list from multiple steps simultaneously.

WARNING\: Any step that will use the results of this Iterator operation will, by default, attempt to assign that step's inputs from a flow variable. If this is left checked, then the first element of the iterator will be used for every cycle of iteration.
4eee6af5-1081-4260-863e-f5f934a93a0f.e8bbcb0a-69f0-421c-aa8a-d1ebcf9d73bc.description=
Check to see if the value stored in a specified flow variable, denoted by key, is null.

Inputs\:
keyName - The key to check, i.e. the name of the flow variable.

Returns\: 
The value in the specified key, i.e. flow variable.

Responses\:
isNull - If the key is a null pointer, i.e. the flow variable doesn't have an assigned value.
notNull - If some value is stored in the key, i.e the flow variable has a value assigned.
4eee6af5-1081-4260-863e-f5f934a93a0f.ecfd0fbf-2d60-4e54-bc7f-d90194901f1e.prompt=Component ID 4eee6af5-1081-4260-863e-f5f934a93a0f.f456aec4-b475-484e-924e-46524f3f4742.description=Counts from one number to another number. 
Inputs\:
from - The number to start counting at.
to - The number to count to.
incrementBy - The number to increment by while counting. If unspecified this is 1. If you wanted to count 2,4,6,8 this would be 2.
reset - If true, then the counter will restart counting from the beginning.

NOTE\: These values must be between -9223372036854775808 and 9223372036854775807

Returns\:
The number that was just counted.

Note\: the primary result is resultString, Result can also be used. result (All lower case) should not be used as it is the response code.

Responses\:
has more - Not yet done counting.
no more - Done counting. This will only be returned once, then counting restarts.
failure - Something went wrong.
4eee6af5-1081-4260-863e-f5f934a93a0f.ff0ad801-84bf-4ab3-b390-cc184d2743bf.prompt=User Identifier
flow.name: Add SiteScope Resource Binding
